question.title: IntelliJ IDEA hides method chain inlay hints when followed by comment
question.body:
I work for a fairly large company that unfortunately has an unchangeable company policy of enforcing line breaks in method chains only via line comments due to the mandated formatter.

So our chains look something like this

list.stream() //
 .map(...) //
 .filter(...) //
 .collect(...);

Without the comments, the IDE delivers helpful inlay hints of intermediate types (when turned on). However, as soon as a comment at the end of the line is present, those hints vanish.

Is there a setting I wasn't able to find to change this behavior?

question_comments.body: This seems to be a bug. See: youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/IJPL-29632
Please add an example of the behavior that you are describing, when it happens and when it doesn't. Screenshots are appropriate for this.
